meanings.definition: The quality or state of being faded.
meanings.sent1: The fadedness of the old photograph made it hard to recognize the people in it.
meanings.sent2: The fadedness of the painting indicated its age and history.
meanings.sent3: The fadedness of the map led to some comical wrong turns during the treasure hunt.
meanings.sent4: Her memories had a fadedness to them, like distant echoes of a forgotten melody.
meanings.sent5: The fadedness of the stars in the morning sky hinted at the approaching sunrise.

meanings.definition: The condition of losing brightness or color.
meanings.sent1: The fadedness of the flowers showed they had been left without water for too long.
meanings.sent2: The fadedness of the fabric suggested it had been exposed to sunlight for a prolonged period.
meanings.sent3: The fadedness of the rainbow made it look like a pastel painting in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The fadedness of her hair color made her look older than she was.
meanings.sent5: The fadedness of the leaves in autumn signaled the change of seasons.

meanings.definition: The act of becoming less distinct or noticeable.
meanings.sent1: The fadedness of the writing on the sign made it hard to read from a distance.
meanings.sent2: The fadedness of the music in the background added to the ambiance of the cafe.
meanings.sent3: The fadedness of his excuse didn't fool anyone; we knew he was late again.
meanings.sent4: The fadedness of her voice in the memory echoed softly in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The fadedness of the footprints in the sand hinted at a passing traveler.
